content.title: Chhatraon Ke Liye Protsahan Rashi
content.details: The 'Chhaatron Ke Liye Protsahan Rashi' scheme Under the Agriculture Department of the Rajasthan government provides financial assistance to economically disadvantaged students who may face challenges in accessing education due to financial constraints. Studying agriculture aims to equip individuals with the knowledge and skills necessary to enhance agricultural productivity sustainably. This includes learning about innovative farming techniques, crop management practices, breeding strategies, and technological advancements that can increase yields and efficiency in agricultural production. Students learn about food safety standards, quality control measures, food processing techniques, and foodborne pathogens to ensure the safety and integrity of the food supply.
benefits: Girls studying agriculture in 11th and 12th standard will receive a scholarship of ₹15,000 per year.

Girls enrolled in undergraduate agricultural programs (4/5 years) like Horticulture, Dairy, Agricultural Engineering, Food Processing, and Shri Karna Narendra Business School, Jobner will receive a scholarship of ₹25,000 per year.
Girls pursuing M.Sc. Agriculture (2 years) will receive a scholarship of ₹25,000 per year.
Girls pursuing PhD in Agriculture (maximum 3 years) will receive a scholarship of ₹40,000 per year.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Girl.
The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
The applicant should be studying in schools, colleges, and universities recognized by the government and state government.
exclusions: On taking admission again in the same class as the students who failed in the previous year.
Girl students who have taken re-admission in the same class for category improvement.
Girls who leave school/college/university in the middle of the session.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme To encourage girl students to study agriculture subject.

faqs.question: Incentive amount will be payable to the Girl students who have taken re-admission in the same class for category improvement?
faqs.answer: Incentive amount will not be payable to Them.

faqs.question: Can boy apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only girls can apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there a Caste-related Eligibility Criteria in this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no caste-related eligibility.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
How can I apply online?
faqs.answer: Click on this link and follow the steps https://ssoapps.rajasthan.gov.in/imsupy/Introduction.aspx

faqs.question: May Other State persons also apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only Rajasthan citizens can apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: How do I know if a field in the application form is mandatory?
How many times can the applicant avail of the benefits of the scheme?
What is Jan Aadhaar?
faqs.answer: Jan Aadhaar is 'one number, one card, one identity' scheme, Its main objective is to prepare a database of demographic and socio-economic information of the resident families of the state and through the Jan Aadhaar card, the identity of the family and its members.
